title: Latest updates: East Midlands Live Friday 19 January 2018 - BBC News
summary: murderer jailed for wrong man stabbing .
obese girl could be taken from mother .
woman jailed over rutland water suicide pact death .
family 's shock at backpacker 's death in sydney .

documents.title: leicester city 2-0 watford
text: leicester city 2-0 watford
author: Craig Lowe
BBC Sport

documents.title: wolverhampton wanderers 0-2 nottingham forest
text: wolverhampton wanderers 0-2 nottingham forest

documents.title: murderer jailed for wrong man stabbing
text: murderer jailed for wrong man stabbing

documents.title: our live coverage has ended
text: regular live coverage on this page has ended for the day , but breaking news , sport and travel updates will continue appear through the night .
east midlands live returns from 08:00 on monday morning .

documents.title: new speed limit 'could reduce accidents ' near school
text: a new 20mph zone , which will cost £ 90,000 to implement , will be introduced on residential streets around a school in hamilton .
leicester city council impose the speed limit around kestrels ' field primary school so it can reduce accidents and encourage more cycling and walking .
the scheme , which follows a public consultation , will be paid for by housing firm redrow homes as part of the planning conditions on a nearby development .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: weather : cold and frosty night ahead
text: it will be a cold and dry night with some frost at first and some wintry showers throughout the evening .
there will be some clouds later in the far south with rain possible towards dawn .
tomorrow will be a dull and cloudy start but the cloud should thin to allow for some brighter weather in the afternoon .
temperatures will reach highs of 5c ( 41f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: teen hacked us intelligence chiefs
text: a 15-year-old gained access to the accounts of some of the world 's most powerful intelligence chiefs from his bedroom in coalville , the old bailey has heard .
kane gamble , now 18 , targetted high-profile figures including the director of the cia , the fbi and the us department of justice .
he took control of people 's email addresses and phone lines , released details of thousands of security agents and a 47-page application for top-secret security clearance .
his barrister told the sentencing hearing that he is on the autistic spectrum and was 15 at the time .

last october , gamble , of linford crescent , coalville , pleaded guilty at leicester crown court to eight charges of performing a function with intent to secure unauthorised access to computers and two charges of unauthorised modification of computer material .
he will be sentenced at the old bailey when the hearing resumes at a later date .
author: Jeremy Ball
Social affairs correspondent, BBC East Midlands Today

documents.title: mayhem in shop after fatal stabbing
text: mayhem in shop after fatal stabbing

documents.title: uk terrorism memorial set for dedication in may
text: a memorial dedicated to uk victims of terrorism overseas is going to be officially dedicated at the national memorial arboretum in may .
the sculpture , called still water , has been installed at the staffordshire site and the government says it commemorates all uk citizens who have been killed in terrorist attacks overseas .
defence minister tobias ellwood 's said today that the dedication will be on 17 may and the families of victims are being invited to apply to attend the dedication .
author: Allen Cook
BBC News

documents.title: watch : pcso 's piano playing pleases pensioner
text: is n't this just lovely - when nottinghamshire police visited a 93-year-old victim of theft , one pcso `` made his day '' by playing one of the man 's favourite pieces .
a nocturne by chopin , if you were wondering .
author: Ben Truslove
BBC News Online

documents.title: investigations continue into fatal crash
text: officers are appealing for information after a motorcyclist died in a crash near mansfield .
ralph weller , 56 , of sutton-in-ashfield was killed on the a617 on thursday last week after the collision involving the motorbike and a car near the junction with water lane .
nottinghamshire police said a 38-year-old woman who was a passenger on the bike suffered serious injuries and the car driver was also injured .
officers want to speak to the drivers of three cars , a silver mini , a white ford kuga and a silver volkswagen beetle , who might have seen what happened .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: tory mp ben bradley admits his language was 'inappropriate '
text: a conservative mp who suggested in a 2012 blog post that benefit claimants should have vasectomies has said some of the language he used was `` inappropriate '' .
ben bradley , who was made tory vice-chairman for youth in last week 's reshuffle , hit out at what he called a `` vast sea of unemployed wasters '' .

in a statement issued by the conservative office on behalf of mr bradley , he said : `` i wrote a number of posts when i was in my early 20s and i accept some of the language i used was inappropriate and i apologise for that .
`` they were written at a different time of my life , getting married , becoming a father and now being an mp have changed my outlook . ''
author: Chris Mason
Political Correspondent

documents.title: 'suicide pact ' woman jailed over death
text: 'suicide pact ' woman jailed over death

documents.title: rapist guilty of second 1992 attack
text: rapist guilty of second 1992 attack

documents.title: fallen tree blocks melton mowbray brook
text: environment agency staff have been clearing a tree from the scalford brook in melton mowbray this afternoon following stormy weather on wednesday night and thursday morning .
they also removed other bits of debris that were clogging up the waterway to prevent flooding .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: forest loan ariyibi to northampton town
text: forest loan ariyibi to northampton town

documents.title: nottingham station fire : police cordon off alleyway
text: an alleyway has been cordoned off so searches can be carried out as part of the investigation into the blaze at nottingham 's railway station .
british transport police have closed the alleyway in station street so forensic officers can search the area .
the fire at the station burned for 12 hours after a new section of the station caught fire on 12 january .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: man who fell from city centre building has died
text: a man who fell from a building in nottingham has died , the charity framework said .
london road was closed temporarily when emergency services , including an air ambulance , were called to the framework hostel at about 12:15 .
the man was a resident at the hostel .
dave smith , director for the charity , said : `` this tragic incident has been very traumatic for residents and for staff who attempted to give first aid at the scene . ''
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: 'items ' found in station arson probe
text: 'items ' found in station arson probe

documents.title: cctv shows chaotic moments in shop after murder
text: this video shows the moments after the fatal stabbing of reuben morris-laing .
remee jarrett , 30 , killed mr morris-laing thinking he was someone else , before chasing his intended target around a shop last march .
he 's been sentenced at nottingham crown court to life in prison with a minimum of 23 years .
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: trial date set for uk terror plot accused
text: trial date set for uk terror plot accused

documents.title: m1 northbound clearing following tanker crash
text: some information for those heading north on the m1 .
all lanes open and vehicles recovered on the # m1 # leicestershire northbound between j23a ( # a42 ) and j24 # kegworth .
severe delays remain back to j22 currently
any further update please or is still delays back to j22 ?
wondering whether to try getting to j25 from j22 or not bother ? !
thanks .
hi hilary , no the delays have significantly reduced so you should be ok .
thank-you !
top tweeting service !
no problem , glad we could help .
please prosecute the perpetrators to the full extent of the law .
to bring the east midlands main roads to a standstill is a disgrace
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: boy 's balloon tribute to grandfather floats to norfolk
text: a balloon released by a three-year-old boy to mark his grandfather 's death has been traced to a field 60 miles away after its discovery went viral .
david james and his brothers each let off a helium balloon in basford in december to mark the passing of david mcdonald .
the young boy 's balloon was found in norfolk on 8 january - the anniversary of mr mcdonald 's funeral .
he got it back after a of it was shared more than 1,400 times .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: man convicted of indecent assault 25 years on
text: a man who confessed to the rape of a student 25 years ago has today been found guilty of indecently assaulting another teenager a month earlier .
christopher scott , 65 , carried out the attacks in nottingham in 1992 .
last year , he admitted the kidnap and rape of a student following a dna match but a second woman came forward after recognising him in a custody photo released following the court hearing .
the first attack happened in september 1992 when scott indecently assaulted and attempted to kidnap the 17-year-old on mapperley hall drive but she managed to flee .
a month later he grabbed an 18-year-old student at a bus stop on mansfield road at knifepoint , dragged her into a car and attacked her .
dna taken at the time matched a sample taken from scott for another matter almost 25 years later and he confessed .
he is due to be sentenced on 15 february .
author: Quentin Rayner
East Midlands Today chief news reporter

documents.title: no cyrille regis tribute planned for rams game
text: i 'm told there will be no minute 's applause for cyrille regis at tonight 's derby county v bristol city match .
the premier league is doing armbands and applause but the efl has n't issued any instructions .
author: Ed Dawes
BBC Radio Derby Sport

documents.title: rowett comes up 'top trumps ' with jerome
text: rowett comes up 'top trumps ' with jerome

documents.title: two appear in court accused of terrorism offences
text: two men have appeared in court charged with the preparation of terrorist acts .
farhad salah , 22 , of no fixed address , and 31-year-old andy star , of sheffield road , in chesterfield , are accused of conducting research into the manufacture of explosive substances .
both appeared via videolink at the old bailey from prison in wakefield .
both men spoke only to confirm their names and their nationality as kurdish iraqi .
they were remanded in custody until a pre-trial review at sheffield crown court in march .

documents.title: scrum-half youngs signs new tigers deal
text: scrum-half youngs signs new tigers deal

documents.title: tailbacks building after m1 tanker crash
text: it 's not looking great on the m1 northbound , where three lanes are closed following a crash involving a tanker .
delays are now stretching back to junction 22 .
the below is from a highways england camera just north of j22 a few minutes ago .
lanes 1 , 2 and 3 remain closed # m1 # leicestershire northbound between j23a ( # a42 ) and j24 # kegworth due to a multi vehicle collision .
severe delays back to j22 currently .
have you got the latest on this ?
will this closure require recovery/debris clearing/surface repairs/further police investigation ?
# m1 # leicestershire # traffic
hi there , all lanes have just re-opened , but severe delays remain back to j22 .
hopefully these will start to clear .
great news !
thank you
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: hospital 'not prepared to allow ' protests
text: the trust which runs nottingham 's two main hospitals says it will put the safety of its patients , visitors and staff first , ahead of an anti-abortion vigil .

the campaign group 40 days for life is planning a protest at the queen 's medical centre on next month but nottingham university hospitals trust said it does n't give the group permission to come on site .

chief executive tracy taylor said : `` previous protests by this group have caused very considerable distress to patients , visitors and staff , which we are not prepared to allow to happen again . ''

a spokesman from 40 days for life said : `` we are always peaceful , even when we are intimidated and abused by pro-abortion protesters , whose aim ( publicly stated on social media ) is to intimidate and harass us until we are forced to leave . ''
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: thorne signs new derby county contract
text: thorne signs new derby county contract

documents.title: your photos : snow in derbyshire
text: plenty of snow in north derbyshire with more on the way .
ditchdigger eve took this photo near charlesworth .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: new deal for rams midfielder
text: derby county midfielder george thorne has signed a contract extension .
it will keep him with the rams until 2020 .
author: BBC Derby Sport

documents.title: person 'fell from city centre building '
text: nottinghamshire police have said emergency services have responded to reports that a person fell from a building in the city centre .
officers were called to london road at 12:37 today .
the force added enquiries are ongoing .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: man detained in pakistan over businessman killing
text: a derby man suspected of shooting dead a businessman almost two years ago has been detained in pakistan , police say .
akhtar javeed , 56 , was killed in february 2016 during a botched armed robbery at his warehouse in digbeth , birmingham .
officers believe 27-year-old tahir zarif fled and went into hiding in pakistan five days after the shooting .
in september 2016 , suraj mistry was found guilty of manslaughter and jailed for 23 years .
two other men were jailed for seven years and six years and eight months respectively for conspiracy to rob .
det insp caroline corfield , from west midlands police , described the arrest as `` fantastic news for the family of mr javeed '' .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: murderer said 'soz bro ' to the man he wrongly killed
text: the court heard from prosecutor peter joyce qc that jarrett `` bore a grudge '' against rakeem thomas , but did not harbour any grievance against the `` entirely innocent '' mr morris-laing ( below ) .
cctv captured jarrett arriving at the shop on robin hood street shortly before 21:25 gmt , when mr thomas and mr morris-laing were both inside .
`` they were both wearing similar clothing and had arrived in similar cars , '' mr joyce said .
`` as has been seen from the cctv footage , jarrett waited immediately outside the store with a large knife in his hand and was intending to stab rakeem thomas as he left the store . ''
mr joyce told the court mr morris-laing left the shop first and was `` immediately stabbed '' in the abdomen by jarrett .

he said jarrett `` knew straightaway that he had stabbed the wrong man '' , and a store assistant heard jarrett say `` soz bro '' to the unintended victim before he went into the shop and chased mr thomas .
mr thomas threw items off the shelves to try to stop jarrett , but was stabbed in the shoulder .
after jarrett fled , passers-by attempted to help mr morris-laing , but he died at queen 's medical centre in nottingham that evening .
author: Liam Barnes
BBC News

documents.title: woman jailed over rutland water suicide pact death
text: a woman who backed out of a suicide pact , leaving a man to die alone , has been given a four-year jail term .
natasha gordon , 44 , was convicted at leicester crown court in december , two years after matthew birkinshaw , 31 , was found dead in his car at rutland water .
she met the postman , from walsall , west midlands , on an internet forum where she agreed to be his `` suicide partner '' .
gordon , described as a `` suicide advocate '' in court , was found guilty of encouraging mr birkinshaw 's suicide .
author: Phil Shepka
BBC News

documents.title: third lane closed on m1 after tanker crash
text: three lanes are now closed on the m1 northbound between junctions 23a and 24 following a crash .
highways england said there was a tanker across lanes two and three with delays back to junction 23 .
lanes 1 , 2 and 3 now closed # m1 # leicestershire northbound between j23a ( # a42 ) and j24 # kegworth due to a multi vehicle collision .
there is a tanker across lanes 2 and 3 , @ twitterid are on scene .
delays back to j23 # loughborough , pls plan ahead .
watched channel 4 news tonight .
family broke down on one our new 'smart motorways ' not on phone to emergency services , when a lorry smashed into the back of them !
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

the road has since reopened and we have contacted nottinghamshire police for more information .

lanes 1 and 2 closed # m1 # leicestershire northbound between j23a ( # a42 ) and j24 # kegworth due to a multi vehicle collision .

documents.title: nottingham road reopens
text: london road towards nottingham city centre has now reopened .
it was closed because of a `` police incident '' .
nottinghamshire police , paramedics and an air ambulance are still at the scene and we have contacted the force for more information .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: breakingmurderer jailed for wrong man stabbing
text: a murderer who apologised to the man he wrongly killed before chasing and stabbing his intended target around a shop has been jailed for life .
reuben morris-laing , 21 , was found outside the store on robin hood street , in nottingham , on 22 march , 2017 , and later died in hospital .
remee jarrett ( below ) , 30 , of kelvedon gardens , has been sentenced to a minimum term of 23 years .
he pleaded guilty last month to three charges , including murder .
jarrett was also sentenced for attempted grievous bodily harm and possession of an offensive weapon at nottingham crown court .
author: Liam Barnes
BBC News

documents.title: nottingham road shut due to 'police incident '
text: london road towards nottingham city centre is currently closed due to a `` police incident '' .
there are also reports of an air ambulance landing nearby .
we 'll bring you more on this as we get it .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: obese girl could be taken from mother
text: obese girl could be taken from mother

documents.title: residents donate tonnes of items for the homeless
text: more than ten tonnes of donations were left out with the bins in a charity drive for the homeless .
residents in rushcliffe were asked to leave non-perishable food , clothing and toiletries out next to their bins earlier this month .
they were up by refuse collectors and taken to the friary charity in west bridgford .
this is the second year rushcliffe borough council has run the scheme but donations have trebled this year .
dave banks , the council 's neighbourhood manager , said : `` originally we set out to provide dry goods , toiletries that kind of thing , that is what the friary had originally requested .
`` but residents have taken it on a stage and provided all sorts of clothing and blankets , i know the friary will put it to good use . ''
if you donated food , toiletries or clothing to @ twitterid last week when you put out your bin , a huge thank you !
you helped us collect over 10 tonnes of items for the charity !
what a brilliant idea
fabulous effort !
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: teenage cancer patient dreaming of trip to japan
text: a teenager with terminal bowel cancer is hoping for a `` dream trip '' in the time she has left .
author: Jo Healey
East Midlands Today

documents.title: witness appeal over arson attack
text: officers are re-appealing for information about an arson and burglary which caused `` extensive damage '' to a house in sutton-in-ashfield .
the elderly occupants of the property in dalestorth road were not at home when it happened .
the fire service was called at 04:40 but nottinghamshire police said someone had broken in between 02:30 and 04:30 on 3 october .
officers have spoken to a 30-year-old in connection with this incident but they are no longer a subject of the inquiry .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: m1 cleared in leicestershire
text: an update for those heading north on the motorway .
debris cleared following a collision # m1 # leicestershire northbound between j21a # leicester and j22 # coalville .
all lanes are now open with minor delays now back to j21a , please approach the area with care .
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: terror attack survivor 'still haunted to this day '
text: a teenager who survived the 2015 tunisian terror attack , has been talking about her life since the ordeal .
millie twells , 18 and from ilkeston , was holidaying with her parents when a gunman attacked the beach resort in june , 2015 , killing 38 people .
she took refuge with other people in an office while attacker stalked the corridors .
she said : `` the room we hid in contained little children , people were banging on the doors to be let in , but we could n't risk their lives . ''
in the time since , she missed months of school and still suffers panic attacks and flashbacks to this day .
earlier this week , she told the nottingham post about her hopes to turn her life around by studying abroad .
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: memorial balloon-find goes viral
text: memorial balloon-find goes viral

documents.title: cycling ban will 'stop kids getting active '
text: a campaign group has criticised a headteacher for banning pupils from cycling to and from school until they have completed their safety training .
ellis guilford school in basford has written to parents saying `` too many students are not cycling responsibly and causing a danger to others '' .
but cycling uk says the move will stop kids getting active .

duncan dollimore from the group said : `` that is just a message that will leave the kids thinking , 'well i ca n't be bothered with doing this , i 'm being singled out i 'll just get in the car and get dropped off ' . ''
headteacher sally coulton says she is fed up of pupils cycling dangerously around the school .

she said : `` there are people driving cars , normal road users and people coming to collect their children we have got a high volume of students walking to school we are trying to manage all that situation . ''
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: is my sat nav breaking the law ?
text: there 's been a fair bit of discussion in the news recently over where on the windscreen drivers should avoid sticking their satellite navigation systems .
radio derby asked derbyshire police for a definitive answer and were sent this helpful diagram .
they said the only illegal position was the green zone .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: fallen tree 'could have killed someone '
text: a 30ft tree which came down in high winds at nottingham 's victoria embankment could have killed someone , an expert said .
james shallcross , tree service manager at nottingham city council , said it was lucky the london plane `` landed in open space '' when it was brought down in strong winds on wednesday night .
he said : `` the wind came from the north and blew it down to the south towards the river .
`` this meant it did n't fall on any property if it landed on somebody or on a car , it would have flattened them and caused fatalities without a shadow of a doubt . ''
the tree , planted about 150 years ago , was removed yesterday afternoon and will now be burnt as bio-mass at a power station .
author: Laurie Dyche
Reporter, BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: traffic stopped on m1 after crash
text: traffic is currently being held on the m1 northbound just after junction 21a following a crash involving one car .
highways england says its staff are clearing debris from the road .
traffic stopped # m1 # leicestershire northbound between j21a # leicester and j22 # coalville due to a single car collision .
@ twitterid are on scene clearing debris from the road , please approach with care .
hello , do we have any update ?
are we expecting lane closures or any ongoing investigation after the debris is cleared ?
- hi there , we have traffic stopped at the moment while we remove our closure .
will be all done soon and we will tweet out to let you know .
thanks
thank you !

BBC News

documents.title: council to purchase land for new leicester road
text: council officials have started the process of forcing the owners of a car park to sell up so they can build a link road .
author: Leicester Mercury

documents.title: def leppard to play nottingham in december
text: def leppard are to perform their bestselling hysteria album in its entirety at nottingham 's motorpoint arena later this year .
the album was a huge hit when it was released in 1987 and features some of their best known singles , including animal and pour some sugar on me .
tickets for the 18 december concert go on sale a week today , with prices starting from £ 42 .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: fire crews dealing with newark crash
text: heads-up if you 're heading to newark .
crews from # newark are currently dealing with a road traffic incident on newark road .
the road conditions are very icy so please be careful out there # drivetoarrive
hi which newark road is this ?
i see there are a few : )
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: second man charged over loughborough stabbing
text: a second man has been charged over the death of a man found in a street with a fatal stab wound .
mark swinhoe , 38 , from long eaton , derbyshire , died at the scene on moira street , loughborough , leicestershire , in the early hours of sunday .
harry matthews , 22 , of loughborough , has been charged with conspiracy to murder , wounding with intent and possession of a bladed article .
christopher cunningham-pithouse , 23 , of queniborough , was charged on wednesday .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: largest council tax rise in 15 years for derbyshire
text: cuts to services in derbyshire will still be made despite taxpayers facing their biggest council tax rise in 15 years .
the conservative run county council says it needs to make cuts to school crossing patrols , libraries , road gritting and services for people with learning difficulties .
leader barry lewis says it 's a difficult position to be in .
he added : `` there are challenges involved with the council tax - we inherited a budget from the previous administration , along with their 5-year plan , which we have to follow through with . ''
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: mourning mother slams conditions at nottingham prison
text: sharon whitford 's son marc maltby killed himself just days after starting a four-month sentence at nottingham prison last year - the fifth death there in a month .

she told radio 4 's today programme her son told her conditions were `` horrible '' , with prisoners harming themselves , not getting food on time , living in `` mucky '' cells and not having attention paid to them by guards .
`` it was uncontrollable - people were taking drugs , they were easy to get , and basically nobody really cared , '' she said .
ms whitford explained there was `` no indication '' over how vulnerable her son 's mental health was , and she is still waiting to find out the full details of how he died .
`` when they 're sent to prison it 's for their own good and to keep them out of trouble and to keep them out of danger , '' she said .
`` obviously that 's not being done , because my son 's not coming home . ''
author: Liam Barnes
BBC News

documents.title: missing mountaineer found in 'good condition '
text: buxton mountain rescue has revealed how it helped find a man who 'd gone missing on scafell pike during last weekend 's bad weather .
richard cockerham , 29 , spent two nights on england 's highest mountain in sub-zero temperatures after going missing on sunday .
considering how long he 'd been out there , when we found him , he was in remarkably good condition . ''
richard - who was later treated for suspected wrist fractures - was found on tuesday when a dog patrol passed close by .
rescuers credited his continual movement as the reason he survived his ordeal .
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: mp wants to see swift improvement at nottingham prison
text: a nottingham mp says improvements need to be made quickly at nottingham prison after the chief inspector of prisons labelled it `` fundamentally unsafe '' .
eight inmates are believed to have taken their own lives in the last two years , levels of self-harm have risen significantly , and inspectors say there 's evidence of dramatic decline since 2010 .
chris leslie , labour mp for nottingham east , said he hoped the criticism would lead to swift action .
he said : `` a lot of people will say 'who cares about prisoners ?
this does n't really matter ' but if you have prisoners that are n't able to be rehabilitated , ultimately they 're going to come back into the community and reoffend . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: car fills with pig sewage after road mishap
text: a driver ended up with a puddle of pig poo in his car after colliding with a tractor in derbyshire last night .
police said the unfortunate motorist was overtaking the farm vehicle when they hit the sewage outlet on its trailer , sending a stream of waste pouring into the car through the driver 's door .
fortunately there were no injuries in the crash , which happened at the a515 roundabout on the a50 near sudbury - just a nasty pong .
think you have had a bad day ?
how about cutting up a tractor on a515 roundabout and colliding with the sewage outlet on the trailer .
then get dragged down the road whilst the car starts to fill with pig waste through the drivers door .
no injuries .
# passtheshakeandvac
@ twitterid this happened in our area .
sudbury i think .
this may have contempt of court written all over it though
who said anything about court ?
has he not been arrested or summoned to court ?
no
thanks
noted .
presumably there will be insurance claims ?
also , why is n't there a prosecution for dangerous driving on the cards ?
simply stating the driver was not arrested and not issued a court summons at roadside .
they are issued by our process unit upon receipt of a file after an investigation has been completed .

not effluent manoeuvre it seems

very good , joe .

the a50 is a dual carriageway .
if you ca n't overtake a tractor on a dual carriageway , you need to have a serious think about your driving .

author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: government warned over 'dangerous ' jail
text: government warned over 'dangerous ' jail
author: Danny Shaw
Home affairs correspondent, BBC News

documents.title: fresh appeal for information on nottingham station fire
text: a week on from the fire at nottingham railway station , british transport police are interviewing commuters to see if they can find out any more about how it started .
officers say they expect the damage to run into millions of pounds , with a new appeal for mobile phone or dashcam footage in efforts to track down those responsible .
detectives investigating the fire have already recovered some `` items of interest '' which will now be sent for forensic tests and fingerprinting .
officers are also trawling through a `` significant '' amount of cctv .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: watch : east midlands weather forecast
text: do n't forget that extra layer when you leave the house , it 's a chilly day .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: family shocked by loughborough student 's death in sydney
text: the family of a british backpacker who was found dead in sydney have said they are `` deeply shocked '' by her death .
the body of amelia blake , 22 , from loughborough , leicestershire , was discovered in a flat in the suburb of newtown on friday .
a man in his 30s was also found dead inside , new south wales police said .
ms blake 's family said the `` much loved daughter and sister '' would be `` truly missed by all who knew her '' .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News
